name: Family Mild Chicken Fajitas with Mexican-Style Brown Rice & Black Beans
description: Skillet-seared chicken fajitas with peppers and onions, served with tomato-scented brown rice and gently seasoned black beans. Mild, family-friendly, and built from scratch.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups brown rice under cold water.
Slice 700 g chicken thighs into thin strips.
Slice 2 onions and 2 bell peppers into strips.
Mince 3 cloves garlic (divide: 2 cloves for fajitas, 1 clove for beans).
Rinse and drain 400 g black beans.
Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F to warm tortillas later.
cook_steps: Start rice: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Add 1/2 sliced onion (save the rest for fajitas) and cook 2–3 min until softened.

Stir in 1 tbsp tomato paste and 1/2 tsp ground cumin; cook 30 seconds. Add rinsed brown rice, 3 cups chicken stock, and 1 cup diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 35–40 min until tender. Keep covered 5 min, then fluff and stir in half the chopped coriander. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Season chicken: In a bowl, toss chicken with 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of black pepper.

Cook fajita veg: Heat a large skillet over medium-high with 1 tsp olive oil. Add remaining sliced onions and all bell peppers with a pinch of salt. Sauté 5–7 min until tender and lightly charred. Add 1 minced garlic clove; cook 30 seconds. Transfer to a plate.

Cook chicken: In the same skillet, add seasoned chicken. Sear 5–7 min, stirring occasionally, until cooked through and lightly browned. Add cooked peppers/onions back to the pan, toss, and squeeze over a little lime. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Warm tortillas: Wrap 10 tortillas in foil and warm in the oven 5–8 min.

Heat beans: In a small saucepan, add 1 tsp olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 minced garlic clove and 1/2 tsp ground cumin; cook 30 seconds. Add black beans and 2–3 tbsp water; simmer 3–4 min until warmed. Season with salt and black pepper. Stir in remaining chopped coriander.
Serve: Set out warm tortillas, chicken fajitas, rice, and beans. Offer lime wedges, sliced avocado, and salsa if using.

Slice 700 g chicken thighs into thin strips.
Slice 2 onions and 2 bell peppers into strips.
Mince 3 cloves garlic (divide: 2 cloves for fajitas, 1 clove for beans).

Start rice: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Add 1/2 sliced onion (save the rest for fajitas) and cook 2–3 min until softened.

Stir in 1 tbsp tomato paste and 1/2 tsp ground cumin; cook 30 seconds. Add rinsed brown rice, 3 cups chicken stock, and 1 cup diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 35–40 min until tender. Keep covered 5 min, then fluff and stir in half the chopped coriander. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Season chicken: In a bowl, toss chicken with 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of black pepper.

Cook fajita veg: Heat a large skillet over medium-high with 1 tsp olive oil. Add remaining sliced onions and all bell peppers with a pinch of salt. Sauté 5–7 min until tender and lightly charred. Add 1 minced garlic clove; cook 30 seconds. Transfer to a plate.

Cook chicken: In the same skillet, add seasoned chicken. Sear 5–7 min, stirring occasionally, until cooked through and lightly browned. Add cooked peppers/onions back to the pan, toss, and squeeze over a little lime. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Warm tortillas: Wrap 10 tortillas in foil and warm in the oven 5–8 min.

Heat beans: In a small saucepan, add 1 tsp olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 minced garlic clove and 1/2 tsp ground cumin; cook 30 seconds. Add black beans and 2–3 tbsp water; simmer 3–4 min until warmed. Season with salt and black pepper. Stir in remaining chopped coriander.
Serve: Set out warm tortillas, chicken fajitas, rice, and beans. Offer lime wedges, sliced avocado, and salsa if using.
